Pre-Game Insights: Billy Gilmour has modelled parts of his game on Toni Kroos's style, focusing on his calmness and composure on the ball.
Gilmour believes Scotland need to keep possession for as long as possible to give themselves a chance against Germany.
Gilmour has confidence in himself and his teammates, but acknowledges that nerves are natural before games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Scotland midfielder, Billy Gilmour, will face off against Germany's World Cup winner, Toni Kroos, in the Euro 2024 opener.
Gilmour has a lot of respect for Kroos's abilities and is eager to test himself against the German midfielder.
The match will be played at Munich's Allianz Arena on Friday evening.
Others: Gilmour has played for Chelsea, Norwich City, and Brighton & Hove Albion in the Premier League, and has gained experience and confidence in his game.
Gilmour was excellent in a Scottish midfield that held its own against England at Wembley in Euro 2020, and has been praised for his performance.
Gilmour has a positive attitude and is looking forward to the challenge of playing against Germany.
